translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Tamāla Flower
The Elder Tiṇasanthāraka’s Birth Story
“The sage who was a giver of gifts
cut grass for the Teacher;
All of them turned to the right,
and fell down on the path.
Taking that grass,
I spread it on the best of earths;
I brought three palm leaves
and at that time.
Having made a covering with grass,
I gave it to Siddhattha;
I held it for seven days
of the Teacher of gods and men.
For ninety-four aeons
the grass I gave then,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving grass.
For five or six aeons,
there were four who were very wealthy;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights …

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tiṇasanthārako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā tiṇasanthārakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: … the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.” 🔽Thus the elder Tiṇasanthāraka recited these verses.
The Elder Tiṇasanthāraka’s Birth Story, the second.
